_header: Free fretteth this world and de confoundeth all
Note: For an epitaph which precedes this, see 2356.
_description: Elegy for the Emperor Frederick, in Part VII of Fabyan’s Chronicle, translating a Latin couplet that precedes it, Septima Pars, Henrici Tercii — one stanza rhyme royal, translating two lines of Latin which precede

HarEng766.Transcription:
ffre ffretyth þis world de confoundyth allHigh thyngis of honour
                    Into depenesse derkRi Serchith besyly the goodis GenerallOf this world
                    both of the lay and ClerkMakyng noo question In his moost Cruell
                    WerkAnd Cus with swerd all thyng doth manaceAnd thus is ffrederik all
                    devoyde of grace
